intro: Neltuma alba var. alba, commonly known as the white neltuma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
